From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From limpio +‎ -ar, or from a Late Latin limpidāre,[1] from Latin limpidus. Compare Portuguese and Galician limpar, Asturian llimpiar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /limˈpjaɾ/ [lĩmˈpjaɾ]
  • Audio (Spain):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: lim‧piar

Verb

[edit]

limpiar (first-person singular present limpio, first-person singular preterite limpié, past participle limpiado)

  1. to clean
  2. to wash
  3. to wipe
  4. (reflexive) to wipe oneself

2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
